Judul: The vernacular architecture of Doha, Qatar
Abstrak:
The urban history of the Gulf states has been largely neglected, with historical studies
of Qatar focusing on its political and economic development. This article presents an overview of the
vernacular architecture of Doha that incorporates non-elite buildings. The life histories of these buildings
tell the story of Qatar's rapid development in the 20th century and the dramatic changes to the society
and urban fabric of its capital. Rapid development threatens to destroy this aspect of Qatar's past, and
we accordingly aim to record the diversity of the historic built environment of Doha.
Sumber: Society for Post-Medieval Archaeology 2017 ;  Post-Medieval Archaeology 51/1 (2017), 81–107
